title: Project creation should confirm the bin directory can be deleted and rebuilt
description: When a user creates a new project for an existing directory structure, we should confirm that the output directory can be deleted and rebuilt. Some users are creating projects and pointing the output folder at a bin directory which contains more than just .class files, and these additional files cannot be rebuilt from the available .java files.
OB: When a user creates a new project for an existing directory structure, the system does not currently provide any confirmation or warning regarding the deletion and rebuilding of the output directory.
EB: The system should display a confirmation message or warning to the user when they create a new project and select an existing bin directory as the output folder.
SR:
1. Open the project creation interface.
2. Choose an existing directory structure as the project location.
3. Select a bin directory containing more than just .class files as the output folder.
4. Proceed with creating the project.
5. Observe whether a confirmation message or warning regarding the deletion and rebuilding of the output directory is displayed.
